page.title: 10ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: There is no organised entertainment in the village. There is a library, The Galloway Library, which was a gift to the village in the early part of the century. It has the limited opening hours of two hours on Tuesday and Thursday evenings and two on Saturday mornings, but it is well patronised in those times. The books are supplied by the North East Fife District Council and the selection renewed at regular intervals. The village hall, complete with stage was built in 1894. It still has the ornate Victorian canopy meant to protect people alighting from their carriages. Concerts,pantomimes and entertainments are held there. A committee of villagers runs the hall.
